backend/main.mo: Main Motoko actor implementing the backend for a finance education platform, including user profile management, password hashing, quiz results, portfolio tracking, predictions, news articles, market alerts, leaderboard, and role-based access control via a mixin authorization pattern.
feature_evidence.json: A feature evidence report mapping implemented feature IDs and titles to their affected files, related components, test IDs, and confidence levels â€” covering UI redesign, glassmorphism components, navigation overhaul, and other frontend features.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: A JSON-formatted text file containing one-to-two sentence summaries of each frontend source file, describing the purpose and notable fixes or additions for pages, components, hooks, and data modules.
frontend/index.css: Global Tailwind CSS entry point defining OKLCH-based CSS custom property tokens for light and dark themes, covering background, foreground, primary, accent, chart colors, sidebar, and border/ring variables.
frontend/index.html: Minimal HTML shell for the React SPA, setting the page title to 'AI-Powered Finance Education & Investment Intelligence Platform' and mounting the app via `/src/main.tsx`.
frontend/src/App.tsx: Root React component that configures TanStack Router with all application routes (home, learn, playground, news, portfolio, advisor, community, profile, API reference), renders the shared layout with TopNav and footer, and guards protected pages behind Internet Identity authentication.
frontend/src/components/BiometricAuthBut: React component that provides WebAuthn-based biometric registration and authentication, storing credential IDs in localStorage keyed by principal, with status feedback and explicit ArrayBuffer allocation for WebAuthn API compatibility.
frontend/src/components/ChatInput.tsx: A chat input component with an auto-resizing textarea and send button that submits messages on click or Enter key, showing a loading spinner when awaiting a response.
frontend/src/components/ChatMessage.tsx: Renders a single chat message bubble with an avatar, formatted timestamp, and distinct styling for user vs. bot messages.
A dialog modal for creating a community forum post with a text area (500-char limit) and optional stock symbol tags (up to 5).
frontend/src/components/ForumPostCard.ts: Displays a single forum post card with author info, relative timestamp, content, stock symbol badges, and an upvote button with vote count.
frontend/src/components/GlassCard.tsx: A reusable glassmorphism-styled card container supporting optional hover tilt, glow variants, and an aurora style variant.
frontend/src/components/HoldingForm.tsx: A dialog form for adding or editing a portfolio holding, allowing the user to select a stock symbol, enter share count, and set an average buy price.
frontend/src/components/LivePriceChart.t: A real-time line chart that streams simulated price ticks for a given stock symbol every 3 seconds, coloring the line teal or red relative to the session open price.
Displays a live-updating price ticker for a stock symbol with flash animation on price changes, showing current price, absolute change, and percentage change with directional color coding.
frontend/src/components/LoginButton.tsx: Renders a login/logout button using Internet Identity authentication, showing an avatar and display name when authenticated or a loading spinner during login.
frontend/src/components/MarketAlertBanne: Displays a list of dismissible market alert banners with severity-based styling (critical/high/medium) and relative timestamps derived from ICP nanosecond time.
Renders a collapsible news article card showing sentiment, market impact, score, date, and related symbols using a GlassCard layout.
frontend/src/components/PasswordSetupMod: A modal dialog for setting or updating a user password, hashing it with SHA-256 before submission and displaying a password strength indicator.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioAllocat: Renders a donut pie chart showing portfolio allocation by holding value, using mock stock prices and Recharts with a custom tooltip.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioPerform: Renders a bar chart displaying per-holding gain/loss percentage, coloring bars green for gains and red for losses using Recharts.
frontend/src/components/PortfolioRiskHea: Renders a scatter chart plotting holdings by portfolio weight vs. simulated sector volatility, with bubble size proportional to holding value.
frontend/src/components/PredictionCard.t: Displays a single stock prediction card showing the user's prediction, AI prediction, and actual outcome with correct/incorrect status and an optional result description.
frontend/src/components/ProfileSetupModa: A modal dialog that prompts new users to enter a display name and saves their profile via a mutation hook to initialize their account.
frontend/src/components/SentimentImpactC: Renders a composed Recharts chart overlaying sentiment score (area) and simulated market price (line) over time from a list of news articles.
Renders a Recharts line chart of historical stock closing prices for a given symbol, with color-coded positive/negative trend and a reference line at the opening price.
frontend/src/components/TopNav.tsx: Sticky top navigation bar with logo, desktop nav links with an animated sliding active indicator, mobile menu toggle, alert badge for critical market alerts, and login/profile controls.
A modal form for admins to submit a new financial news article with title, summary, stock symbols, and market impact score, then persist it via a mutation hook.
frontend/src/data/learningTopics.ts: Defines TypeScript interfaces for quiz questions and learning topics, and exports an array of educational finance topics (e.g., stock market basics) each with markdown content and associated quiz questions.
frontend/src/data/mockStocks.ts: Defines interfaces for OHLC stock data and mock stocks, provides a random price history generator, and exports a list of mock stocks (AAPL, MSFT, GOOGL, etc.) with simulated price data.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: Custom React hook that creates and caches an ICP backend actor using React Query, supporting both anonymous and authenticated (Internet Identity) usage, and invalidates dependent queries when the actor changes.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: Provides an Internet Identity authentication context and hook for React, managing login/logout state via DFINITY's AuthClient and exposing identity, login status, and helper flags.
frontend/src/hooks/useLivePrice.ts: Custom React hook that simulates a live-updating stock price by polling a mock price source at a configurable interval, returning current price, previous price, session change, and direction.
frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts: Centralizes React Query hooks for all backend data operations including user profiles, password management, learning progress, and predictions, each wiring actor calls to queries and mutations with cache invalidation.
frontend/src/index.css: Global stylesheet that imports fonts, configures Tailwind CSS, and defines a custom OKLCH-based design token palette (Deep Void + Neon Violet + Electric Lime) with light/dark mode variables and reusable glass-card component styles.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Entry point that renders the React app wrapped in QueryClientProvider and InternetIdentityProvider contexts.
frontend/src/pages/AdvisorChatPage.tsx: Chat page that provides a rule-based AI financial advisor, generating responses based on user portfolio, prediction accuracy, and news sentiment.
frontend/src/pages/AdvisorPage.tsx: Alternative advisor page with a more detailed AI response engine that builds system context from portfolio, news articles, and prediction history to generate financial advice.
frontend/src/pages/ApiReferencePage.tsx: Interactive API reference page that lists public backend endpoints with schemas and allows users to execute live calls and view JSON responses.
frontend/src/pages/CommunityForumPage.ts: Community forum page where authenticated users can create posts, upvote content, and browse investor insights sorted by latest or top voted.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Landing page showcasing the platform's six main modules and key features with an animated SVG candlestick hero graphic.
frontend/src/pages/LearningModulePage.ts: Displays a grid of finance learning topics with overall progress tracking, showing completion status per topic and linking to individual topic pages.
frontend/src/pages/NewsModulePage.tsx: Renders a financial news dashboard with sentiment analysis charts, market alert banners, article filtering, and visualizations including area, bar, radar, scatter, and pie charts.
frontend/src/pages/PortfolioAnalyzerPage: Provides a portfolio management UI where users can add/remove stock holdings and view analytics including sector allocation, performance simulation, and risk scoring via multiple chart types.
frontend/src/pages/ProfilePage.tsx: Shows the authenticated user's profile summary including learning progress, prediction accuracy, portfolio performance, and security settings like password and biometric auth.
frontend/src/pages/StockPlaygroundPage.t: Implements a stock prediction arena where users select a stock, submit directional predictions, compare results against AI forecasts, and review prediction history with accuracy stats.
frontend/src/pages/TopicLessonPage.tsx: Displays a single learning topic's lesson content with markdown-like rendering, showing completion status, navigation to previous/next topics, and a link to the topic's quiz.
frontend/src/pages/TopicQuizPage.tsx: Renders a multiple-choice quiz for a given learning topic, tracks answers, submits results, saves progress on-chain, and displays a final score screen.
frontend/src/utils/urlParams.ts: Utility functions for reading URL query parameters (supporting both standard and hash-based routing), persisting them in sessionStorage, and removing sensitive params from the URL hash.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom fonts, OKLCH-based color tokens, border radii, box shadows, and keyframe animations for the app's design system.
project_state.json: Project state manifest (version 23) describing the AI-powered finance education platform's architecture, existing features, known issues, and image requirements.
